alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Laramie County through 345 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitaker to Warren AFB to near Natural Fort. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 34. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 354 and 375. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
